      • populateJourneySpinner

        public void populateJourneySpinner(java.util.ArrayList<City> cities)
        Function that fills up the 'Spinner' elements with the existing cities. The cities are retrieved from the database via the CityDAO class.
        Parameters:
        cities - ArrayList containing of the information related to the retrieved cities.

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(android.view.Menu menu)
        This is the function that takes care of disabling one option in the 'Options menu' so it cannot be used before the info from the database has been retrieved.
        Overrides:
        onCreateOptionsMenu in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        menu - This is the menu itself.
        Returns:
        You must return true for the menu to be displayed; if you return false it will not be shown.
        See Also:
        Activity.onPrepareOptionsMenu(android.view.Menu), Activity.onOptionsItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem)

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(android.view.MenuItem item)
        This function handles the different possibilities for the 'Options Menu'.
        Overrides:
        onOptionsItemSelected in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        item - This is the menu itself.
        Returns:
        boolean Return false to allow normal menu processing to proceed, true to consume it here.
        See Also:
        Activity.onCreateOptionsMenu(android.view.Menu)

      • createCityList

        private java.lang.String[] createCityList()
        This function creates a list that contains city names.
        Returns:
        String array containing the name of the cities only.

      • getId

        private int getId(java.lang.String name)
        Basically this function just returns the id of the city, if no city was found the the function will return -1
        Parameters:
        name - this is the name of the City, based on that we can get the id of the city
        Returns:
        the id of the city that corresponds to the name sent as an argument

      • toResultsActivity

        private void toResultsActivity()
        This function just takes the name of an activity and it is in charge of making the transition from one activity to another. Sometimes it is necessary to pass some arguments to the next activity and this function handles that as well.

      • prepareInfo

        private void prepareInfo()
        This function is in charge of formatting data so it can be displayed properly.

      • formatDate

        private java.lang.String formatDate(int day,
                          int month,
                          int year)
        This function is in charge of formatting the date so it matches the format of the database.
        Parameters:
        day - Day.
        month - Month.
        year - Year.
        Returns:
        String containing the formatted date.
        See Also:
        String

      • toAnotherActivity

        private void toAnotherActivity(java.lang.String name)
        This function just takes the name of an activity and it is in charge of making the transition from one activity to another. Sometimes it is necessary to pass some arguments to the next activity and this function handles that as well.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the next activity, the one to be initialized.

      • onCreateView

        public android.view.View onCreateView(android.view.View parent,
                             java.lang.String name,
                             android.content.Context context,
                             android.util.AttributeSet attrs)
        Description copied from class: android.app.Activity
        Standard implementation of LayoutInflater.Factory2.onCreateView(View, String, Context, AttributeSet) used when inflating with the LayoutInflater returned by Activity.getSystemService(java.lang.String). This implementation handles tags to embed fragments inside of the activity.
        Specified by:
        onCreateView in interface android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2
        Overrides:
        onCreateView in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent that the created view will be placed in; note that this may be null.
        name - Tag name to be inflated.
        context - The context the view is being created in.
        attrs - Inflation attributes as specified in XML file.
        Returns:
        View Newly created view. Return null for the default behavior.
        See Also:
        LayoutInflater.createView(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, android.util.AttributeSet), Window.getLayoutInflater()

      • onCreateView

        public android.view.View onCreateView(java.lang.String name,
                             android.content.Context context,
                             android.util.AttributeSet attrs)
        Description copied from class: android.app.Activity
        Standard implementation of LayoutInflater.Factory.onCreateView(java.lang.String, android.content.Context, android.util.AttributeSet) used when inflating with the LayoutInflater returned by Activity.getSystemService(java.lang.String). This implementation does nothing and is for pre-Build.VERSION_CODES.HONEYCOMB apps. Newer apps should use Activity.onCreateView(View, String, Context, AttributeSet).
        Specified by:
        onCreateView in interface android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory
        Overrides:
        onCreateView in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        name - Tag name to be inflated.
        context - The context the view is being created in.
        attrs - Inflation attributes as specified in XML file.
        Returns:
        View Newly created view. Return null for the default behavior.
        See Also:
        LayoutInflater.createView(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, android.util.AttributeSet), Window.getLayoutInflater()
